sentence.text: Chudley-McCullough syndrome (CMS) is a rare autosomal recessive disorder characterized by sensorineural deafness, agenesis of the corpus callosum, frontal polymicrogyria, interhemispheric cyst, and ventricular enlargement.

The combination of sensorineural hearing loss and partial agenesis of the corpus callosum is a highly recognizable clinico-radiological entity that should prompt mutational analysis of the GPSM2 gene.
